title: High Deposit Interest Rates
description: In 2023, Argentina offered one of the highest deposit interest rates globally at 94.99%, attracting savers but indicating potential economic instability.

title: Significant Claims on Central Government
description: The claims on Argentina's central government grew by 341.37% as a percentage of broad money in 2023, reflecting a heavy reliance on government borrowing.

title: Negative Net Financial Flows
description: In 2023, Argentina experienced a net financial outflow of $5.07 billion in IMF nonconcessional loans, indicating financial challenges.

title: High Taxes on Exports
description: In 2022, taxes on exports constituted 16.41% of Argentina's tax revenue, suggesting a significant reliance on export taxation for government income.

title: Negative IFC Private Nonguaranteed Flows
description: Argentina saw a negative flow of $139.95 million in IFC private nonguaranteed loans in 2023, highlighting challenges in attracting private investment.

title: Strong Agricultural Productivity
description: In 2023, the value added per worker in Argentina's agriculture, forestry, and fishing sectors was $174,267.88, showcasing high productivity in these industries.
